bug.author: bensdm
bug.description:
Thank you for this amazing job. A must have package ! However I have trouble with quite large dataset, that's why i am trying to disable correlations by changing config file with correlations argument: df[:10].profile_report(correlations = {'pearson': True, 'spearman': False, 'kendall': False, 'phi_k': False, 'cramers': False}) return: ConfigTypeError: correlations must be a collection, not str
<denchmark-link:https://www.kaggle.com/c/ieee-fraud-detection/download/train_identity.csv>https://www.kaggle.com/c/ieee-fraud-detection/download/train_identity.csv</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: thanks for your quick reponse, i am working on google colab (python 3) edit: sorry for the inconvenience, it is now working, not sure what i was doing wrong

I have pandas v1.0.3, pandas_profiling v2.6.0 <denchmark-code>profile = pandas_profiling.ProfileReport(pos_covid_df, correlations={'pearson': True, 'spearman': False, 'kendall': False, 'phi_k': False, 'cramers': False}) </denchmark-code>
And I'm getting this error: <denchmark-code>ConfigTypeError: correlations must be a collection, not list </denchmark-code>

The correlation config is slightly different: <denchmark-code>profile = pandas_profiling.ProfileReport(pos_covid_df, correlations={'pearson': {'calculate': True}, 'spearman': {'calculate': False}, 'kendall': {'calculate': False}, 'phi_k': {'calculate': False}, 'cramers': {'calculate': False}}) ``` </denchmark-code>

I'm trying to run Configuration shorthands <denchmark-code>r = ProfileReport(df) r.set_variable("samples", None) r.set_variable("duplicates", None) r.set_variable("correlations", None) r.set_variable("missing_diagrams", None) r.set_variable("interactions", None) r.to_file(output_file="Report1.html") </denchmark-code>
also r = ProfileReport(df,samples=None, correlations=None, missing_diagrams=None, duplicates=None, interactions=None) but getting an error ConfigTypeError: correlations must be a collection, not NoneType It is a large dataset 100 columns and 100000 rows Using pandas_profiling==2.7.1 and python 3.7.1
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jheel-patel>@Jheel-patel</denchmark-link> That shorthand was probably not supported back then, please update
